title: Lotto
description: After the entire warehouse staff wins the lottery and quits their job, Darryl becomes depressed and demands to be fired. Meanwhile, the office staff is forced to load the truck for their orders themselves.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ....back orders and you never called them.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Can you believe this?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There's a dog in the car.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You can't leave a dog in a parked car. [points to "I'd rather be snowboarding" bumper sticker] Snowboarder, it figures.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do Snowboarders hate animals?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I bet this guy didn't leave his weed in the car. OK we have to do something because this is incredibly dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oscar, it's not that hot out.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: A car parked in the sun is like a toaster oven.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, we don't know how long the driver's been gone and it's not in direct sunlight.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: So what, Andy, you wanna just let him die, you scumbag?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Here, I'm gonna get in my car. When I start dying, I will honk the horn three times. That means save the dog.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, you know what? I'm gonna give him something to drink. Come here, doggy. [Whistling and pouring water from bottle into sunroof of car] Come on.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight! At least aim it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There you go! Here doggy! He's not even trying. Come here doggy, come on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We're losing cloud cover.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh don't try to get in on it now, Michael Vick.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. Vick did his time.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This guy's been gone long enough. He's lost his right to a window. [Oscar approaches the vehicle with a tire iron]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa whoa whoa whoa!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Come on buddy, get back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa, Oscar! What are you- What? No, hey! [Oscar busts out back window, group cries out in protest, then cheers]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright! Nice job, Oscar!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And one for good measure! [Busts out taillight, group applauds]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So...ah, who's gonna take the dog?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why would we take the dog?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What if he jumps out the window and runs away?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jim, he's not gonna star- [Dog lunges for open window and barks]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Shh! Shh! Stay there, stay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nein. Sits. [snaps as dog calms] Goot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oscar, what do you wanna do, this is kinda your deal. You wanna dog?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [Oscar pokes holes in cardboard now taped over window] There we go. That should do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that's pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, that'll work.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That'll work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bye poochie!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Bye. [Andy barks]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Bye! [Kevin's horn honks twice shortly, then one long honk. Shot shows him passed out on his steering wheel.]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's that come to? Like, what did they each win?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh man, it's gotta be over a hundred thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Before taxes.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's still a lot of money!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The warehouse crew won the lottery yesterday. Nine hundred and fifty thousand dollars. And then they quit!...and no one else can focus. [shot shows warehouse crew going wild in the office] This is it. This is all on my shoulders. I'm the one who has to tell everyone to get back to work, I'm the one who has to tell Darryl to hire a new warehouse crew. I'm the one who has to say those things.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [On phone] Hello?....Justine! [laughs] Nice surprise! How you doin' baby?....Nah. No no, I didn't win. When I got promoted I stop-...what?...Yeah. Yeah, Glenn won....Oh, you wanna call him? Yeah, you should call him, congratulate him. That'll be-...What?....Oh, his number's in your old phone. Oh, you know what? I might have it right- [hangs up] Whoops.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: When I worked in the warehouse, I was part of that lotto pool. They won ... playing my birthday.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What really interests me is the group dynamic of six people winning the lottery. This will not end well. Right?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: We're lookin' at at least one suicide and one weird sex thing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: At least.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean, I don't even know what I'd do with all that money.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know what you'd do with all that money. [imitating Jim] "Hey Pam, let's buy expensive bathrobes and hug."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'd probably buy a big piece of land in Maine, build a house, work in town. Somewhere I could bike to or kayak to. I'd either bike to my job at the kayak shop or kayak to my job at the bike shop.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And then on the weekends, would you hacky sack back to reality and spend time with your wife and kids?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa. Saucy. I thought you liked Maine?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think we should get a townhouse in SoHo...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: SoHo's mostly lofts but OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And then every morning, I'd walk out on to my terrace and I would breathe in the inspiration of the city. You know? And just gather ideas for my painting...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, god.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And then my handsome husband...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which ideally would be me....

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Would bring me a flavored coffee.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stop. I'm a barista in your fantasy?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well in your fantasy we're Stephen King characters.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know about Stephen King, I mean...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [under her breath] get a divorce...get a divorce...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I think I would keep working. And for my salary I guess I would take like a dollar a year....I mean obviously I wouldn't come in till noon and I wouldn't do anything I didn't wanna do. I mean I'm getting paid a dollar a year, OK? You can chill.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?! Guys if I have to ask you to get back to work one more time, I'm gonna change my tone. [lowers voice] To down here like Mr. T. and this will get seriously annoying. I feel sympathy for the jerks who have to listen to this all day. [normal voice] Darryl, how we doin' on the new warehouse guys?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What d-? What..what? Wuh, do we have new guys, or what?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are they on their way over?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I haven't hired anyone.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What? No warehouse guys? I have an important order that has to go out by five. I emailed you about it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm not checkin' email till lunch. Four hour work week.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is kinda time sensitive.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I got it. I'm doin' it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy, this is a seriously big order. I can't lose this client.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, well until we have a new crew, let's get some volunteers for warehouse duty. Who's in? [Erin raises hand]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: As long as you guys don't need me up here.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No..we don't

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think we'll be fine. [group murmurs in agreement]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Really, nobody's gonna help her? Is chivalry dead?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you volunteering?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Of course. I would. But my hip....I would kill to be at a hundred percent. [Angela rolls eyes]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim! How 'bout you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, yeah. I mean, as the strongest person in this office, I guess I should go down with you...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey...OK no. No. That. You are so not...oh god. [grunts] False. Andy, I will volunteer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great. And Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Good old Kevin. He'll do anything. Well guess what? I will not do a good job.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, wait. What's this? [holds up clipboard]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, sorry. I thought it was a guess your baby's birth weight pool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It says "Lotto Pool", right on top. [points to obvious title]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah. And I said sorry.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh come on. You really think I'm gonna have a fourteen pound baby?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: When did I get so fat?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You look awesome.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I didn't hire anyone if that's why you're here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where are we in the process?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I have a file of applicants here. I just gotta open it, look at it, interview a bunch of guys,hire some of 'em. So I'd say we're in the early stages of the process.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you go out celebrating with the guys last night?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The guys did invite me out to celebrate but I decided to just stay home. Eat a bunch of tacos in my basement.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You do have a fantastic basement.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I did. I did have a fantastic basement. Now it smells like tacos. You can't air out a basement and taco air is heavy. Settles at the lowest point.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right. Um, well how 'bout we take a look at some applications? ...This guy wrote his in green ink, that's pretty cool. Check it out. [attempts to give Darryl application who ignores him at first but then takes it]Hey! There ya go...there he is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is not Darryl. I don't know where Darryl is. I suspect probably our Darryl is inside of fat Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK. Three hundred boxes of twenty pound white. That's seventy-five boxes per person, so that's not so bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Negative! Three hundred boxes for me, zero for you chumps. Deal with it! [climbs into forklift]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice. [Dwight runs forklift into wall of warehouse] Whoa whoa whoa whoa! Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Damn! [Dwight reverses pulling the wall with him. Erin screams. Dwight leaves forklift and begins lifting boxes by hand.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Welcome, everybody! My name is Andy and this is my other brother Darryl.[no one laughs] What? No Newhart fans? OK...Darryl, how do we usually kick these things off?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You mean what did we do the last time the warehouse won the lottery?

quotes.speaker: Female Applicant
quotes.text: Your old crew won the lottery?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Does anyone have experience? Shelving, storing, keeping track. What do we use, the Dewey Decimal system?

quotes.speaker: Male Applicant #1
quotes.text: Wait, wait. So all the old guys quit?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well-

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: One of 'em, Glenn, is starting one of those fat camps where he steals your kid in the middle of the night. Madge and a couple other guys might start a strip club, but on a boat. And Heday is investing in an energy drink for Asian homosexuals. [Andy laughs awkwardly]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, can you guys give us a minute? But stay close, you're all doing great. [group begins leaving] maybe grab a coffee..or if there's any donuts out you can split one. You know they're for everybody so people get fussy....You know what? Just have a donut. [shuts door and sits, gesturing for Darryl to sit next to him. Then gets up to stand near Darryl.] Do you wanna talk about this not winning the lottery thing?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You sure? Cause you keep talking about it, so...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nope. I'm good. I'm here. Let's find some warehouse workers.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good. Great. Then can you say things that aren't like a huge bummer to everybody? Cause the more I talk, the more they're gonna realize I don't know what I'm talking about.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We need you, OK?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Grunts while lifting box into truck] What's the problem? Grunting is scientifically proven to add more power. Ask any female tennis player. Or her husband. [Erin grunts loudly and tosses box toward truck but misses]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I didn't feel anything.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright! Thank you for coming back in, again. Uh, now we're gonna ask you a few questions. Darryl, you have the floor.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why do you wanna work here?

quotes.speaker: Male Applicant #1
quotes.text: I need a job.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's not a good reason.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good. Keepin' 'em honest.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Don't just take the first job that comes your way. Cause next thing you know, it's ten years later and you're still there. Could write your obituary tomorrow, it's not gonna change.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are we scaring them straight....?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I hope so. Think about this carefully. There's better lives than this one.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I've never been lucky. And I'm not talkin' about the lottery, I'm talkin' 'bout stuff like developing a soy allergy at thirty-five. Who gets a soy allergy at thirty-five? And why is soy in everything?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Nice. Right back where I like you. [Pam is sitting at reception covering for Erin] Can you make ten copies of this for me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Why not? What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, buying lottery tickets online. [Ryan laughs]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ah, everyone wants to be rich, but nobody wants to work for it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You came in at 10:30 today, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK, (we'll just dismiss it.)??????

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is everyone licensed?

quotes.speaker: Male Applicant #2
quotes.text: Like a driver's license?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Warehouse license....Masters in warehouse sciences?...I, I feel like Darryl has talked about a license of some kind.

quotes.speaker: Female Applicant
quotes.text: Is this a joke?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Not joking. This is real....painfully real, what is happening right now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [On all fours with a box on his back] OK, I'm not gonna make it. I'm turning back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's gotta be a better way to do this. This is literally how they built the pyramids.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, they whipped people which was helpful. But you're right. We should be able to find a more efficient way of moving boxes than Madge or Heday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah [laughs and then notices camera] Not that they're not smart people.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Noticing camera] No, no. Very smart. Uh, theirs is more of a physical intelligence.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'd go with that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like baboons or elephants.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not that, don't...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Guys! When I was a kid, my sisters used to butter me up and slide me across the linoleum floor of the kitchen. Then really made them laugh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's a great idea Kev, I don't think it applies here though, so maybe we just-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah we move stuff and it was fun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin! Doesn't apply.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right. My mom-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [grabbing Kevin's arm] You need to drop it, OK? They hate it. I like it a lot but they hate it so drop it! [Kevin tears up]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Does anyone get distracted easily by bubble wrap? [raises hand and laughs] You'll be dealing with lots of bubble wrap obviously. Um...

quotes.speaker: Male Applicant #1
quotes.text: How much longer is this gonna take?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Did you hire 'em?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Because they all left.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What do you mean "they left"?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, after you bailed? I got confused and frankly a little weird and the stuff that you said certainly didn't help.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Then I think you should fire me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you talking about? I'm not gonna fire you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah. Just put me out of my misery.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: .....OK, this is weird. I don't, I don't get the joke.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No? OK. I don't wanna be here anymore. Fire me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So Darryl says to me "fire me". But what he really means is "I'm gonna say something really weird, try and figure out what it means." So I say "No, you're not fired." But what I really mean is "I have no idea what your talking about, but I'm gonna go ahead and hire some people for the warehouse and hope that you eventually start feeling better."........I really hope that's what he and I mean.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Attention! Does anyone know anyone who could work in the warehouse? We can pay. Come on Oscar, who's the most jacked guy in all of Scranton? Like your wildest fantasy guy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Bulk or definition?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Definition.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Bruce Kenwood. He hangs out at Plant Fitness.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are those just show muscles? Or is he really strong?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, he's plenty strong.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It used to be Reggie Winters out at Gold's Gym. But he moved away. And then it was between Bruce and this guy Dean. Um, but Dean got fixated on his calves and uh, and his triceps went to hell.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So. I've been thinking, after we win the lottery, we take our winnings....

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Our fake winnings

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we move to the south of France. See? No, there's plenty of bicycling for you. I think that's where they do the Tour de France.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is, yeah. I mean I just don't know why I'm compromising if it's my fantasy. Cause in my fantasy it's Maine and you love it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because I'm never gonna act like that, even in your fantasy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope. You're, you're doing a great job of it in my fantasy right now. [Pam sighs]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, idiot. What did Erin want again?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A...hot chocolate tea

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Gideon. You are a PhD candidate studying America's diminishing blue-collar workforce?

quotes.speaker: Gideon
quotes.text: North America...and, diminishing is a little reductive, but uh sure. That's the headline version.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great....Well, it'll bring a fresh new perspective to the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Gideon
quotes.text: FYI, Wednesday through Friday I have a pretty full teaching schedule.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Eh, cool. We'll figure that out.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Also, FYI, ah, I don't techinically have a hearing problem, but sometimes when there's a lot of noises occurring uh at the same time, I'll hear 'em as one big jumble. Uh, again it's not that I can't hear, uh because that's false. I can. Um, I just can't distinguish between everything I'm hearing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Got it. Dually noted. You! [points to Bruce] Coolest tank top I have ever seen. Where did you get that?

quotes.speaker: Bruce
quotes.text: Made it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So cool! What a cross-section we have here. That's what I love about interviewing. I get to meet all these people I wouldn't ordinarily meet or know or even talk to.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Message in a Bottle, The Postman...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kevin Costner.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Kevin Costner.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. [Shot shows Kevin and Erin greasing floor of warehouse]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So I found this grease. And then I remembered that you thought it was a great idea.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You did say it was a great idea. I heard you say it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, it's not the dumbest idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not the greatest one either...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But, the fact remains we gotta move these boxes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And it's clear we're not going to carry them. [Dwight grunts loudly in shot showing them sliding boxes over the greased floor]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So sadly, it's the best idea on the table.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think we're ready to give thi- [Kevin slips on grease and falls] Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is he OK?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yep. He'll be fine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Surprise! Your new crew.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Would you just fire me, man?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why? Because you didn't win the lottery? How am I supposed to make you happy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You wanna make me happy? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Give me your job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Haha, what?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll do it better than you. I earned it. I deserve it. I got passed over, God knows why, reasons I cannot and will not understand. The job was mine Andy, everyone said it was mine. Make me manager or fire me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm not gonna give you my job! It's my job! I earned it! And here's the thing, you weren't even next in line. I asked about you, I saw your file. You have a history of being short with people and you hired Glenn, your buddy! To replace you in the warehouse. He was under qualified. They saw that.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Also, Darryl, FYI, I already told this to Andy, but uh, you should probably know I technically don't have a hearing problem, it's just when there's a lot of noises...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nate! Please....thank you. You have no business education, you were gonna take classes under D'Angelo, what happened to that?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: He died.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He didn't die, his brain died. And my brain is still very much alive and I'd be happy to give you business classes. How come you haven't asked me about it?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: What wa-, what was the last...I'm havin' a-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: None, no part of this has anything to do with you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I didn't have time because of my daughter.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, but you had time for a softball clinic, and a Mediterranean cooking class.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey I'm not gonna tell you this stuff if you gonna throw it back in my face.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey. Here's the thing. Jo saw something in you. She loved you! She gave you a shot and then you stopped pushing. She noticed. [long pause]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK what?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: OK, don't fire me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah, OK.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: My future's not gonna be determined by seven little white lotto balls. It's gonna be determined by two big black balls. I control my destiny. I do.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I put some guys on tonight. Best of your bunch and my bunch. Tell you now though, it's gonna be mostly my bunch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. [laughs] That makes sense. OK. Good, alright.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Here...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What is goin' on?! [shot shows greased aisle flanked by rows of boxes]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh hey guys.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Why is the forklift in the wall?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why is the truck empty?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, it's not totally empty.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Is that grease on my floor?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, I can see why you're angry, you're coming into this cold. But believe me a lot of thought went into this.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And did your brains tell you to ruin these boxes with grease?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: OK Darryl, listen and then you will understand. The boxes were ruined during our first trial testing so now it's cool cause we found another use for them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, alright, that's...look. All we were trying to do is we thought we could come up with a more efficient way to do things.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: And?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And we did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Jim? Tell them what it's called.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's alright.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No Jim, tell 'em what a name is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Doesn't matter what the name is. Señor Loadenstein, that's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [laughing] Señor Loadenstein. Tell 'em why it's called that, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's OK, we're good.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Jim...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, Jim. Tell us why it's called Señor Loadenstein.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Porque es muy rapido.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK. You know what? It's been a real busy day, what do you say we put all this away.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Let me see it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's uh, it's in beta testing.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Let me see it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Get the thing, go! Lube it up, Kevin! Start mopping.

quotes.speaker: {dwight}, {erin}, {jim} & {kevin}
quotes.text: Uno! Dos! Tres! [Shot shows Jim & Dwight pulling ropes attached to a plank holding Erin in a helmet and boxes of paper down the greased runway, Dwight grunts]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I lost my client.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I already won the lottery. I was born in the US of A, baby. And as backup I have a Swiss passport.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I would spend a lot of time launching my true crime podcast, The Flenderson Files. Dum bum buh. [whispers] Flenderson files.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We came to an agreement. We're going to live in a stunning pre-war brownstone at the top of a mountain.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right. It's city and country combined.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just a subway stop away are the best museums in the world.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I can fish right from the window of Pam's pottery studio. And we can chat any time we want.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just like now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Just like now....too bad the schools are terrible.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh..

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But what are you gonna do about that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you gonna do?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: If I won the lottery, I don't know. I don't think I'd make any changes to my life. Quit my job, move, meet someone....

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd give 35% to AIDS related charities. 25%. If they can't cure AIDS with 25%, the extra ten's not gonna make a difference. At some point, you're just throwing good money after bad.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: The first thing I'd buy is new boobs. For my mom. She has the worst boobs. It- It's embarrassing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, ok. We are so close. All we have to do is figure out that corner and we're basically there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know. Kevin, we've been friends for a long time, right?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Egons.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So if I was to ask you to sacrifice your body and lay down on a greasy corner and act as a human bumper shield-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, Dwight! Come on. Here, I think I have an idea.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I wouldn't be asking you lightly, now would I?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right. Now do you wanna wear a trash bag, er...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dammit Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: However it's normally done.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, I have a question. Why is the truck so far away?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah Jim, why's it so far?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Why's it so far away?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, I just asked that ques-, I don't know. I mean it seems like the door is huge, right? So you should be able to back the truck up to the paper.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, why is it so far away Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So this warehouse has been around for what? Like a thousand years? And they never thought to back the truck up into it? I guess sometimes it just takes a fresh set of eyes. Alright! [knocks on side of truck]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Back...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That looks good. Back. Whoa whoa whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa whoa whoa!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You're doing great! A little farther away from the wall!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No no no!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Good...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No! Stop! Stop stop stop stop! You're way over! Ok, you gotta cut it! Cut it hard! (bleep!) Stop stop stop stop! Stop, stop! Dammit Dwight. Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Good.
